## Journal Form Test
Go to admin journal search page at /admin/journals
From the facet "In DOAJ?" on the left choose True
Click "Edit this journal" link at the bottom of any journal - note the id of the edited journal for future reference

Expected Test Results: Page /admin/journal/<id> is open in a new browser window/tab (<id> is id of the chosen journal)
All the field are initially filled in with correct values

Action: Click red "Withdraw" button at the top of the functions panel on the right

Expected Test Results: Message pop-up appears over the page asking you to confirm if you want to withdraw the journal and shows you the journal's ID.

Action: Click Close

Expected Test Results: The box closes and nothing else has changed.

Action: Click Withdraw again and click Withdraw in the pop-up

Expected Test Results: You see a flash message at the top which says Job to withdraw/reinstate journal has been submitted

Action: Click link to the background jobs interface in the banner

Expected Test Results: The set_in_doaj background job is created

Action: Click "More Information"

Expected Test Results: set_in_doaj__journal_ids parameter contains correct journal id and set_in_doaj__in_doaj -- false parameter is set

Action: Close the background jobs window
Click "Unlock and Close" button at the top of the application

Expected Test Results:
You see the message: This record is now unlocked
You may close this tab safely.
Close the tab.

Action: Go back to the admin search page
From the facet "In DOAJ?" on the left choose False
Click "Edit this journal" link at the bottom of any journal - note the id of the edited journal for future reference

Expected Test Results: Page /admin/journal/<id> is open in a new browser window/tab (<id> is id of the chosen journal)

Action: Click "Reinstate" button at the top of the functions panel on the right

Expected Test Results: Message banner appears at the top of the page with the confirmation

Action: Click link to the background jobs interface in the banner

Expected Test Results: The set_in_doaj background job is created

Action: Click "More Information"

Expected Test Results: set_in_doaj__journal_ids parameter contains correct journal id and set_in_doaj__in_doaj -- true parameter is set

Action: Close the background jobs window
Close the journal form and go back to the admin search page
Click "Edit this journal" link at the bottom of any journal - note the title of the edited journal for future reference
Open Editorial Area -> Editor Group dropdown and start writing the name of the Editor Group

Action: Choose any Editor Group name

Click red "Save" button below

Expected Test Results: Message banner  "Journal updated" is displayed and additional ones with information about emails sent

Action: Go to Notes section at the very bottom of the functions panel on the right
Click "Notes" red button

Expected Test Results: New note section appears below

Action: Put any text in the note text area
Click red "Save" button

Expected Test Results: Banner appears at the top of the page "Journal updated"

Action: Click 'Dismiss' at the right end of the banner

Expected Test Results: Banner is dismissed
In the "Notes" section next to your added note the date field is filled in with correct date and time
